intro: Onychium chrysocarpum, commonly known as the golden-fruited onychium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruits are bright orange or yellow, giving it its common name, and are often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions.
